snippet: The Republican nominee tried to move on from the conspiracy theory that said President Obama was not born in the United States, which he has been clinging to for years....
abstract: Donald Trump says in short statement at event in Washington that he believes Pres Obama was born in United States; Trump's statement goes on to falsely accuse Hillary Clinton of stirring up questions about Obama's birth during 2008 primary contest.

byline.original: By MAGGIE HABERMAN and ALAN RAPPEPORT
byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Yamiche Alcindor, Nick Corasaniti, Julie Hirschfeld Davis and Jonathan Martin.

lead_paragraph: The Republican nominee tried to move on from the conspiracy theory that said President Obama was not born in the United States, which he has been clinging to for years.

headline.main: Trump Drops False ‘Birther’ Theory, but Floats a New One: Clinton Started It
headline.print_headline: Trump Drops False ‘Birther’ Claim but Offers New One: Clinton Started It
